overview: This subject continues from Dynamics to deepen the students’ understanding of Engineering Mechanics, specifically focusing on Analytical Mechanics:

• Kinematics and Generalised Coordinates.
  • Virtual Work and Virtual Displacement, Generalised Force.
  • Energies: Kinetic, Potential.
  • Lagrange approach: dealing with constraints.
  • Lagrange’s Approach to obtaining equation of motion.
  • Comparison to Newton-Euler Approach.
  • Hamiltonian Mechanics.
  • Linearisation of system dynamics about equilibrium points (system stability about equilibrium points.
ilo: 1. Independently formulate physical and mathematical models for three-dimensional dynamic analysis of mechanical systems;
2. Solve the mathematical models by means of specialised analytical and numerical methods.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: One written closed book examination. ILOs 1-2 are addressed in the exam.
One mid-semester test, ILOs 1-2 are addressed in the test.
Three written assignments not exceeding 30 pages in total, due in weeks 4, 6, and 11. ILOs 1-2 are addressed in these assignments.

date_times.contact_hours: 36 x 1 hour lectures and 12 hours of workshops
